intro: Thelypteris namburensis, commonly known as the Nambu rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Thelypteridaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. This plant is characterized by its evergreen, leathery fronds that are typically clustered at the base of the plant. The fronds are usually dichotomously branched and have a distinctive, often serrated margin. Thelypteris namburensis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on rocky substrates or in forest undergrowth.
